chunks.content:
Welcome to  
salary packaging 
the Maxxia way
Workplace benefits for 
Melbourne Health employees

Introducing salary packaging 
the Maxxia way
Melbourne Health has chosen 
Maxxia as your workplace 
benefits provider to bring 
you the best possible salary 
packaging experience 
We’ve specialised in workplace benefits 
for close to 30 years. In that time, we’ve 
worked hard to perfect salary packaging 
so that you can maximise your tax 
benefits, make claims faster and easily 
view account balances anytime. Maybe 
that’s why we’re the largest and a 
trusted supplier of salary packaging 
throughout Australia.
Salary packaging in a nutshell
Fully approved by the Australian Tax 
Office, salary packaging lets you pay  
for things like the everyday costs of 
living with money from your salary 
before tax. This reduces your taxable 
income, meaning you could pay less  
tax and take home more of what you 
earn. No matter whether you work 
full-time, part-time or casually – if you 
expect to pay income tax, you could  
be better off. 
Watch our video to find out more.
1
The salary packaging difference
Without salary packaging
With salary packaging

Your pay
Your pay Everyday costs of living
These costs reduce your  
taxable income
Tax
Tax
Reduce your tax!
Everyday costs of living Less disposable income
More disposable income

Meal entertainment 
– up to $2,650 
Meal entertainment lets you salary 
package the cost of meals when you 
eat out, meaning you could save every 
time you dine with friends and family 
at restaurants, cafes, pubs, clubs and 
bistros. The $2,650 cap is over and  
above the cap for everyday living 
expenses, so it’s a great way to get  
even more from your salary.
Capped benefits
Everyday living expenses  
– up to $9,010 
Those everyday living expenses sure add 
up, but with salary packaging you can 
pay for them before you get taxed! 
•  Mortgage and rent
•  Gas and electricity expenses 
• Groceries and clothes
• Personal loan repayments
• Private health insurance premiums
• School fees
2
With capped benefits there’s a limit to how much you can salary 
package each Fringe Benefits Tax year (1 April – 31 March).
Imagine you earn $60,000 
per year. By salary 
packaging up to $9,010 in 
everyday living expenses 
you could be up to $2,977 
better off each year.
Without salary 
packaging
Making everyday living expenses work for you
With salary 
packaging
$38,743  
disposable income
$41,720  
disposable income
$2,977 
net benefit*
*Estimate only. Individual circumstances may vary. 
See back page for assumptions.

Maxxia Wallet^ gives you simple access 
to your salary packaging and meal 
entertainment benefit money. You can 
use it to pay for capped benefits like 
groceries, fuel, bills and meals with 
others, online or on the phone.
 •  Manage both Salary Packaging and 
Meal Entertainment benefits with  
one smart card
 •  Tap and go with Visa payWave
  •  Make real savings on everyday 
entertainment and wellbeing offers 
through our Maxxia Everyday Savings.
Corpora
te
^See back page for general advice.
Live, spend  
and save
!Everyday

Uncapped benefits
Novated leasing 
Novated leasing lets you salary package 
the cost of getting into and running a 
new car with some of your before tax 
dollars (over and above any that you use 
for capped benefits) – and potentially 
lower your taxable income.
New or used, we can help you find the 
car you want and negotiate with dealers 
to secure a great price that doesn’t 
include GST or any upfront fees.
Once you’ve decided on the car you 
want, we can set up a salary packaging 
account. Then we’ll arrange a budget  
for your lease repayments and running 
costs like fuel, registration, insurance  
and maintenance. The cost of everything 
is bundled into one regular, set-and-
forget payment drawn from your salary 
each pay.
4
On top of the capped benefits, you can also take advantage of a range  
of uncapped benefits.
Without  
novated leasing
Potential tax benefit of salary packaging a car plus $9,010
With  
novated leasing
$24,456 
disposable income
$30,256  
disposable income
$5,800 
net benefit*
*Estimate only. Individual circumstances may vary. 
See back page for assumptions.
Work-related self-education 
When you work, continuous learning 
is important. So it makes sense to pay 
for your self-education expenses with 
before tax dollars.
Professional memberships and 
subscriptions 
You could also salary package any 
professional memberships as well as the 
cost of your work-related newspapers, 
journals or magazines.
Let’s say you earn $60,000 
per year. By leasing a 
$34,000 car over 4 years, 
travelling 15,000 kms 
annually and a 35% residual 
value, you could be up to 
$5,800 better of each year.

5
Maxxia online 
services
The Maxxia app makes accessing your 
account a breeze, with functionality 
designed to make life easier.
You can update personal details and bank 
accounts, view all your balances in one 
place, track your Maxxia Wallet spending 
with ease and claim 24/7. 
Detailed account transactions let you see 
your incoming and outgoing payments, 
while the Maxxia cap tracker allows you 
to monitor your salary packaging cap 
limits quickly and easily.
The Maxxia app lets you manage your 
account, your way. So you can do more 
with your time.
Available on both Android and iPhone.

Maxxia benefits
We also offer benefits outside of salary packaging that are available to 
everyone – regardless of whether you decide to salary package or not.
Maxxia Rewards 
Our Maxxia Rewards program gives 
you discounts and benefits at hundreds 
of retail outlets, department stores, 
attractions, travel, cinemas and 
restaurants nationwide. It’s free to  
join, so register now.
6

Start doing more  
with your money
1300 123 123
(8am–7pm, Mon –Fri AEST)
maxxia.com.au/healthcare
Salary packaging: The estimated potential tax benefit is based on the assumption that an eligible employee salary packages the full 
$9,010 per annum limit. PAYG tax rates effective 1 July 2018 have been used and average Fees and Charges are included. Tax, benefit and 
Medicare Levy calculations are approximate, and assume no other taxable income is received. HELP repayments and taxation surcharges 
are excluded.
Meal entertainment: The Meal Entertainment benefit has an annual cap limit of $2,650 and will appear as a reportable item on your 
Payment Summary each year. This cap is separate from the FBT cap limits for everyday living expenses.
General advice warning: The information about the Maxxia Wallet is general in nature and does not take into account your personal 
objectives, needs and circumstances. You should consider the appropriateness of the information having regard to your personal 
circumstances and consider the Product Disclosure Statement (PDS) before making any decision.  A copy of the PDS can be obtained from 
live.maxxia.com.au/pds or by contacting us on 1300 123 123.  The Maxxia Wallet is issued by Heritage Bank Limited ABN 32 087 652 024, 
AFSL and Australian Credit Licence 240984. Maxxia Pty Ltd acts as authorised representative of EML Payment Solutions Limited ABN 30 
131 436 532, AFSL 404131 as distributor of the Maxxia Wallet.
Novated lease: The estimated potential tax benefit is based on the assumption that you would have paid for the lease from your post-tax 
salary (as opposed to salary packaging those payments from your pre-tax salary, or a combination of your pre and post-tax salary). The 
estimated annual benefit will vary depending upon salary, employment circumstances, selected benefits and applicable tax treatment. This 
example assumes that benefits to the value of $9,010 (excluding GST) are already packaged and that the novated lease is in addition, a 
4-year lease term, an annual distance travelled of 15,000kms and a 35% residual value. The base value of the vehicle for FBT purposes is 
$33,606. The total amount financed is $32,017 including on-road costs. The estimated annual operating costs are $14,287 which includes 
estimates of fuel, maintenance, registration, comprehensive insurance and fleet management fee. GST of 1/11th is payable on your ECM 
contributions.
Important information: This general information doesn’t take your personal circumstances into account. Please consider whether this 
information is right for you before making a decision and seek professional independent tax or financial advice. Conditions and fees apply, 
along with credit assessment criteria for lease and loan products. The availability of benefits is subject to your employer’s approval. Maxxia 
may receive commissions in connection with its services. Maxxia does not act as your agent or representative in respect of the purchase of 
any vehicle. Maxxia does not provide any advice or recommendations in relation to the purchase of any vehicle.
Maxxia Pty Ltd | ABN 39 082 449 036
Read the product disclosure statement available from us or the product issuer before making a decision about insurance.
